org.apache.juneau.html

Class HtmlSerializerContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.Context
      • org.apache.juneau.serializer.SerializerContext
        • org.apache.juneau.xml.XmlSerializerContext
          • org.apache.juneau.html.HtmlSerializerContext
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    HtmlDocSerializerContext

    public class HtmlSerializerContext
extends XmlSerializerContext
    Configurable properties on the HtmlSerializer class.

    Context properties are set by calling ContextFactory.setProperty(String, Object) on the context factory returned CoreApi.getContextFactory().

    The following convenience methods are also provided for setting context properties:

    • HtmlSerializer.setProperty(String,Object)
    • HtmlSerializer.setProperties(ObjectMap)
    • HtmlSerializer.addNotBeanClasses(Class[])
    • HtmlSerializer.addBeanFilters(Class[])
    • HtmlSerializer.addPojoSwaps(Class[])
    • HtmlSerializer.addToDictionary(Class[])
    • HtmlSerializer.addImplClass(Class,Class)

    See ContextFactory for more information about context properties.

    Configurable properties on the HTML serializer
    Setting nameDescriptionData typeDefault value
    HTML_uriAnchorText Anchor text source. String "TO_STRING"
    HTML_detectLinksInStrings Look for URLs in Strings. Boolean true
    HTML_lookForLabelParameters Look for link labels in the "label" parameter of the URL. Boolean true
    HTML_labelParameter The parameter name to use when using HTML_lookForLabelParameters. String "label"
    Configurable properties inherited from parent classes
    • BeanContext - Properties associated with handling beans on serializers and parsers.
      • SerializerContext - Configurable properties common to all serializers.
    Author:
    James Bognar (james.bognar@salesforce.com)

    • Field Detail

      • HTML_uriAnchorText

        public static final String HTML_uriAnchorText
        Configuration property: Anchor text source.

        • Name: "HtmlSerializer.uriAnchorText"
        • Data type: String
        • Default: "toString"

        When creating anchor tags (e.g. <a href='...'>text</a>) in HTML, this setting defines what to set the inner text to.

        Possible values:

        • TO_STRING / "toString" - Set to whatever is returned by Object.toString() on the object.
        • URI / "uri" - Set to the URI value.
        • LAST_TOKEN / "lastToken" - Set to the last token of the URI value.
        • PROPERTY_NAME / "propertyName" - Set to the bean property name.
        • URI_ANCHOR / "uriAnchor" - Set to the anchor of the URL. (e.g. "http://localhost:9080/foobar#anchorTextHere")
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HTML_detectLinksInStrings

        public static final String HTML_detectLinksInStrings
        Configuration property: Look for URLs in Strings.

        • Name: "HtmlSerializer.detectLinksInStrings"
        • Data type: Boolean
        • Default: true

        If a string looks like a URL (e.g. starts with "http://" or "https://", then treat it like a URL and make it into a hyperlink based on the rules specified by HTML_uriAnchorText.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HTML_lookForLabelParameters

        public static final String HTML_lookForLabelParameters
        Configuration property: Look for link labels in the "label" parameter of the URL.

        • Name: "HtmlSerializer.lookForLabelParameters"
        • Data type: Boolean
        • Default: true

        If the URL has a label parameter (e.g. "?label=foobar"), then use that as the anchor text of the link.

        The parameter name can be changed via the HTML_labelParameter property.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HTML_labelParameter

        public static final String HTML_labelParameter
        Configuration property: The parameter name to use when using HTML_lookForLabelParameters.

        • Name: "HtmlSerializer.labelParameter"
        • Data type: String
        • Default: "label"

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        • Default: false
